column1: 81) It would be seen that Article 154J(1) confers on the President the power to issue
directions to the Governor of a Province regarding the manner in which he should
exercise executive power. According to Article 154F(1) read with Article 154C of
the  Constitution,  unless  the  Constitution  has  provided  otherwise,  the  Governor
shall  exercise  his  functions  (including  executive  functions)  on  the  advice  of  the
Board of Ministers and the Chief Minister at the head of such Board of the relevant
Province.  It  would  thus  be  seen  that,  the  Governor  exercising  executive  power
